section: i-on will maintain the operation of the Hosted Site continuously, twenty-four (24) hours per day, seven (7) days per week, including holidays, with the exception of reasonable hardware and software maintenance that must be performed on the Hosting Computer and/or the Hosted Site. i-on will schedule and perform such maintenance during any time of the day, including weekdays.
explanation: The first sentence guarantees continuous operation except for 'reasonable hardware and software maintenance'. The second sentence then states i-on will perform such maintenance 'during any time of the day, including weekdays'. This creates a contradiction, as maintenance at 'any time' could disrupt the 'continuous' operation promised in the first sentence, creating uncertainty for the customer.

section: The Customer is responsible for paying i-on the recurring monthly fee in the amount of $450. The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fees by the 20th day of each month beginning in April 1, 1999. The Customer acknowledges that failure to pay such fees in a timely manner will result in the interruption or discontinuation of services for the Hosted Site.
explanation: The second sentence says that the recurring monthly fee must be paid by the 20th day of each month beginning April 1, 1999. However, in the third sentence, it says that failure to pay the fees in a timely manner will result in the interuption or discontination of services for the Hosted Site. This introduces contradictory statements and ambiguity. It is not explained how the interuption or discontination of services happens, which makes the reader assume it is done immidiately. Thus the statements are contradictory and create ambiguity as to the conditions of paying the monthly fee.

section: This Agreement shall automatically be renewed for one (1) or more one (1) month periods unless either the Customer or i-on gives notice to the other party of its intention not to renew the Agreement, which notice must be given not less than five (5) days before the end of the respective initial or renewal term. Either party may terminate this Agreement without cause at any time effective upon thirty (30) days' written notice.
explanation: This change creates a contradiction regarding termination. The first sentence provides an automatic renewal for one month, which requires a 5 day notice to prevent renewal. The second sentence allows termination 'at any time' with 30 days notice. The ambiguity arises from the term 'at any time' with 30 days notice, because it's not stated if it means during the renewal period or not.
